nodes.text: Keshian spice rolls were a sweet dessert made with citrus and spices topped with icing. At one point, when chef Strono Tuggs was making a batter, his sous-chef, Robbs Ely, snatched away the bowl, adding his own ingredients and producing Keshian spice rolls that were so tasty, Tuggs decided not to fire Ely for having ripped the bowl from him. Sometime later, Tuggs included a recipe for the dessert in his first cookbook, The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook.

Keshian spice rolls were a type of roll served for dessert. They were prepared with a pink batter, spices, a spicy filling, and hints of citrus and ginger, and they were then topped with a white icing. The rolls were consumable by Artiodacs and Volpai, and they shared their name with the Keshian species.

At some point during their careers in Maz Kanata's castle on the planet Takodana, chef Strono Tuggs was stirring some basic batter when his sous-chef, Robbs Ely, took the bowl and spoon away in disgust and began adding spices that Tuggs did not expect, nearly leading the Artiodac to fire him. However, Ely was able to change Tuggs's mind by baking Keshian spice rolls that were some of the best Tuggs had ever tasted. Despite Ely being secretive with his recipes, his unexpected death led to Tuggs acquiring them.

At some point after the Battle of Takodana in 34 ABY, Tuggs included a recipe for Keshian spice rolls in his cookbook The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, where he shared the story of Ely making the spice rolls. He also noted that even up to the time that he wrote the book, eating one of the rolls reminded him of Ely and prompted him to smile.

Keshian spice rolls were introduced in the 2019 recipe book Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, which was authored by Chelsea Monroe-Cassel and Marc Sumerak. The out-of-universe recipe for the rolls calls for a beet, water, sugar, an egg, buttermilk, butter, dry yeast, salt, all-purpose flour, and cooking spray.
The filling then requires brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, more all-purpose flour, and more butter. Lastly, the icing needs powdered sugar, orange extract, and heavy cream.
